list.name: Default Changelist
list.comment: Solve medium problem, split a string such that it results into max number of unique substrings using backtracking.

task.summary: Default task
Add hint towards using prefix sum to find a subarray that has the target xor.
Add hint towards using prefix sum to find a subarray that has the target xor.
Add an optimized constant time solution for designing a MaxFrequencyStack by leveraging the fact that maxfrequency will be continuous
Actually add the optimized solution for designing a MaxFrequencyStack
Solve medium and a bit tricky problem, find the optimal index to place a line that intersects the least amount of bricks using greedy voting algorithm.

Solve medium and a bit tricky problem, find the smallest cost to reach last row from first row in a triangle using DFS + Memoization.
Learnings: I made the implementation complicated by solving it via Djikstra/Greedy instead of solving it via simple DFS + Memoization. Greedy would have been optimal in case the graph had cycles.

Solve hard and extremely tricky design LFU cache using hashmap of key -> node + Doubly linked list of frequency -> set of nodes with the respective frequency.
I was not able to fully solve this problem on my own. I was not able to cleanly implement how to find the smallest frequency and reshuffle nodes to +1 frequency node in DLL. Once I saw the paper, I was able to visualize it clearly and was able to implement it cleanly as well.

Solve easy and extremely tricky to optimize space complexity, find two nodes in a BST whose value equals k using iterative BST traversal.
Learnings: Iterative traversals are very tricky.

Solve medium find two nodes in two BST that sums to target node using iterative traversals. Perform a inorder iterative traversal for the first tree and a reverse inorder iterative traversal for the second tree.
Leveraged prior learning of doing iterative BST traversal.
Solve medium balance a given BST using Divide and conquer. In order to reduce the space complexity to O(1) need to use DSW algorithm.

Solve medium and extremely tricky to do in O(1) space, rotate an image clockwise 90 degrees in place by swapping the cells in group of 4's using recursion.
Very happy to solve this question on my own in first attempt.

Solve medium and a bit tricky problem, find the no of total hits on counters received in last 5 minutes using deque.
In my initial implementation, I implemented the solution using custom binary search by writing upper_bound() and lower_bound() but the solution became simplified after knowing that the timestamps are sorted for both getHits() and hits(), so we can simply use a deque for storing elements.

Solve medium and a bit tricky problem, find the kth largest element in an array using quick select algorithm.
Trick was to select a random pivot between [low, high] to reduce worst case time complexity.

Solve hard and extremely tricky to optimize, find whether a word with the provided suffix and prefix exists in dictionary or not using reverse indexes in trie.
Trick was to generate all possible query patterns for a word and insert into trie ie. apple can be searched via "apple|ap", "ple|app", "pple|ap". Don't forget to store useful information ie. index directly in trie node to avoid performing DFS.

Solve medium find the smallest unreserved seat using treeset.
Leveraged prior learning of solving seat allocation problem using ordered set.

Solve medium and a bit tricky problem find min adjacent swaps required to reach kth smallest number by first finding the kth next permutation and then finding the min swaps by logic similar to insertion sort.

Solve medium and extremely tricky to do in O(1) space using tricky recursion, find all the gray codes of n digits.
Was able to do it on my own by maintaining a visited set and try flipping a bit.
Solve medium and a bit tricky to optimize time and space complexity to O(n) and O(logn) by leveraging the inorder traversal of a sorted list to convert it to a balanced BST.
Update class name to match problem statement name

Solve medium and a bit tricky problem, split the array into at most k groups such that sum of averages is maximised using recursion + memoization.
Do note that the largest average would be possible by splitting into maximum groups, so the problem statement reduces to split the array into k groups such that sum of averages is maximized.
Leveraged past learnings of solving similar split array problems.
Solve medium find the time required to fill memory sticks by consuming i bits every ith second using simulation.

Solve medium and a bit tricky problem, find the box contents after rotating a box containing stones and stationary obstacles using two pointers.
Leveraged previous learnings of simulating rotation using transpose + reverse.

Solve medium find whether the provided strings match the provided pattern by maintaining a mapping from source to target and from target to source.
Very similar to previously solved problems.

Solve medium find the minimum path sum to reach any cell of last row from any cell in the first row using recursion + memoization.
Leveraged prior learnings of directly using DP as the graph does not contain any cycles.

Solve medium and a bit tricky problem, find the maximum length of concatenated string such that it does not contain any duplicate char using bitmasking + backtracking.
Leveraged prior learning of using bitmasking to find common characters in strings and then applied backtracking by either choosing to concatenate current string or skipping current string.

Solve medium, find no of pairs whose sum equals target sum provided you can increment the value at any index, by maintaining a hashmap of value to its frequency.
Leveraged prior learnings of solving two sum problems.

Solve medium and a bit tricky problem, find the min no of swaps required to make a binary string alternating using greedy. Target string would either start from 1 or from 0. Result would be the smallest mismatches between those. Care must be taken to weed out the impossible swaps cases.
Leveraged prior learning of solving alternating string problem.
Add comment to tag a reverse index/lookup problem.

Solve medium problem, find the min speed of train required to arrive before time using binary search.
Leveraged prior learning of solving binary search problem. Followed errichto's template.

Solve hard and a bit tricky problem, find the min cost to make at least one valid path in a grid where we can flip the cell value to reach other cell by incurring a cost of 1. Tricky thing was to imagine it as a connected graph with unconnected cell having edge weight of 1.
Was not able to solve this question on my own. Need a lot of practice on hard problems.

Solve medium and a bit tricky problem, find the min number of deci binary numbers that sum to the target value using greedy.
Trick was to build the answer digit by digit by keeping track of number of 1's required per digit.

Solve medium problem, find the maximum sum of subarray containing unique elements using sliding window.
Leveraged prior learning of solving "maximum" sliding window problem.

Solve medium and a bit tricky to optimize find whether a string is composed by interleaving substrings from two different string using DP.
Leveraged prior learning of solving similar string related recursive problems. Tricky thing was to reduce time complexity from n^3 to n^2 by reducing no of states by generating redundant states from remaining states.

Solve medium problem, find the shortest path to get nearest food in a matrix using BFS.
Leveraged prior learning of applying BFS to find shortest path in an unweighted cyclic graph.
Add approach and related multi BFS problems in RottingOranges
Add approach and related tricky problem for LargestPlusSign.

Solve medium problem, find the shortest distance from nearest 0 for each cell using Multi BFS.
Tricky thing was to solve this problem using DP in multiple passes. Learnt something new tonight.

Solve medium and extremely tricky problem find the largest rectangle after performing horizontal and vertical cuts using greedy.
Learnings: Reduce the rectangle problems (2D) into 1D and then solve for each dimension independently ie. find the largest horizontal cut and vertical cut which would result in the rectangle with largest area.
Add medium and extremely tricky problem, find the smallest impossible subset sum that is not possible to be generated from an array using greedy

Add solution for medium and extremely tricky problem, find the cheapest flight within k stops from a source to destination using modified djikstra.
Learnings: This is a weighted graph, so need to apply Djikstra but we have another constraint apart from cost, so maintain another array similar to cost[]. Visit an edge only if it either reduces the cost or reduces the no of hops.

Add another solutions to hard and extremely tricky problem, find the shortest path in a grid with obstacle eliminations using Djikstra and BFS by maintaining additional state per node.
Learnings: Since this was a unweighted graph, BFS was the way to go. But we need to maintain additional state per node, so either maintain a nested array with additional dimension or maintain additional array similar to cost array. Visit an edge only if it reduces the cost or reduces no of eliminations. Last but not the least. Maintain a consistent state every node.
Solve medium find distance between two nodes in a binary tree by finding the LCA.

Solve easy problem, arrange an array into pairs such that sum of minimum of all pairs is maximized using greedy.
Trick was to organize into pair such that waste is minimum. Since we are interested only in the minimum value of the pair, any number we pair with it would go to waste. So we need to pair it with a value >= ai.

Solve easy problem, find the maximum subarray of size k in an array using sliding window.
Learnings: Smallest negative double value is -Double.MAX_VALUE or Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY. Double.MIN_VALUE is actually the smallest positive value. Mind blown! Learnt something new today.
Add approach and related problems in RepeatedStringMatch problem. Find the minimum number of times a string has to be repeated such that another string is a substring of it.
Add approach and related non overlapping problems in NumberOfGoodWaysToSplitString
Solve medium problem, split a string such that it results into max number of unique substrings using backtracking.

Solve easy and a bit tricky problem, split a string such that it results in all balanced substrings, containing equal no of L and R using greedy.
Reduce the problem to finding balanced parentheses substrings in a string by assigning -1 to L and 1 to R.
Update README by adding "How to use" instructions.

MESSAGE.value:

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
